matched.actualTitle: XML External Entity (XXE) Injection in SOAP Service - File Read
matched.matchReason: Both findings identify the same XXE vulnerability in the SOAP service endpoint. The expected finding references unsafe XML parsing configuration with resolve_entities=True at app.py lines 156-157, and the actual finding confirms this exact vulnerability with proof-of-concept demonstrating file read capability through DOCTYPE external entity injection. Both describe the same attack vector (XXE) with identical impact (file disclosure, SSRF, DoS).

extra.title: Werkzeug Debug Mode Enabled - Information Disclosure
extra.assessment: New discovery - debug mode enabled exposing sensitive information including hardcoded SECRET_KEY, stack traces, and framework internals

extra.title: Werkzeug Debugger Enabled with Exposed Debug Console
extra.assessment: New discovery - Werkzeug debugger accessible on errors with debugging information exposed

extra.title: Werkzeug Debugger Remote Code Execution via Discovered PIN
extra.assessment: New discovery - debugger PIN can be calculated allowing RCE through EVALEX capability

extra.title: No Rate Limiting on Login Attempts - Brute Force Attack Possible
extra.assessment: New discovery - no rate limiting or account lockout mechanisms on login attempts

extra.title: Missing CSRF Tokens on Login Form
extra.assessment: New discovery - login form lacks CSRF token protection

extra.title: Missing Security Headers on Login Endpoint
extra.assessment: New discovery - missing X-Frame-Options, X-XSS-Protection, X-Content-Type-Options, CSP, HSTS, and Referrer-Policy headers

extra.title: Incomplete Session Termination - Missing Session Cookie Expiration on Logout
extra.assessment: New discovery - logout endpoint does not properly clear session cookies

extra.title: IDOR Vulnerability in GetAccountInfo SOAP Service
extra.assessment: New discovery - no authorization checks on account_id parameter allows unauthorized access to financial data

extra.title: IDOR Vulnerability in GetAccountHolderInfo SOAP Service
extra.assessment: New discovery - no authorization checks allow unauthorized access to PII (name and email)

extra.title: Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) on Logout Endpoint
extra.assessment: New discovery - logout endpoint accepts GET requests without CSRF token validation

extra.title: SOAP Service Information Exposure in CSS File
extra.assessment: New discovery - CSS file exposes SOAP service identifiers and implementation details

extra.title: Missing Security Headers on Static Files
extra.assessment: New discovery - static files served without security headers (X-Content-Type-Options, X-Frame-Options, CSP, etc.)

extra.title: Missing Authentication Validation on Logout Endpoint
extra.assessment: New discovery - logout endpoint accepts unauthenticated requests without session validation

extra.title: Server Information Disclosure Through HTTP Headers
extra.assessment: New discovery - Server header exposes Werkzeug/3.1.3 Python/3.13.3 version information

extra.title: Missing Cache-Control Headers on Logout Endpoint
extra.assessment: New discovery - logout response lacks Cache-Control, Pragma, and Expires headers for cache prevention
